document.masterDocTitle: New species of Triplonychus Candèze and Globothorax Fleutiaux from Brazil (Coleoptera, Elateridae, Cardiophorinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New species of Triplonychus Candèze and Globothorax Fleutiaux from Brazil (Coleoptera, Elateridae, Cardiophorinae)

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology. From Latin, latus = broad, dens = dente, alluding to the large mandible of this species.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material.
Holotype
. [Cuiabá-MT, Faz. Mutuca, vale do R. Mutuca
4–11 .X. 2008
, interceptação, J. R. M. Rocha, A. L. Silva & F. H. Gava col], male ( MZUSP ).

Paratypes
. Same label as the holotype ,
200 males
( MZUSP ),
20 males
( UFMT ). Idem , but
25 .X. 2008
52 males
( MZUSP ); 29 .XI– 6 .
XII. 2008
9
males ( MZUSP ).
Ocurrence. BRAZIL . Mato Grosso state: Cuiabá.

Remarks. Thousands of male specimens of
Globothorax latidens
sp. nov .
were collected from October to December with flight interception traps (FIT) with peak population in early October at the beginning of the rainy season. No females have been collected.
